custom_fields.key_topics: Language, memory, visual processing, attention and cognitive control, intorudction to computational cognitive science
custom_fields.goals: 1 For students to understand how human cognition works. 2 For them to understand the general methods and bodies of knowledge from various fields that can contribute to our understanding of the brainbehavior relationship.
custom_fields.relevance: Teaching students the foundations of cognitive science, introducing the tools commonly used in investigating brain and cognition, clarifying the link between cognitive studies and other fields such as computer science, math, statistics, and medicine.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Research articles, slides, audio and video samples, etc.

long_desc: This course focuses on the fascinating way that the brain processes the world and allows us to interact with it. Aside from covering the major topics in cognitive psychology language, memory, visual processing, attention and cognitive control, it includes an introduction to some of the most recent approaches to studying human cognition. The course is set up to highlight the connection between cognitive studies and skills in various majors such as computer science, math, statistics, and medicine. It is also structured to foster the necessary skills for the critical analysis of complex problems.
name: Cognitive Psychology
